description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams called the US immigration system broken and said he’d reach out to Donald Trump’s incoming administration with suggestions as the President-elect’s policy agenda takes shape.
title: NYC Mayor Says He Wants to Work With Trump on Immigration Policy

description: After plowing at least $132 million into the president-elect’s campaign, the richest man in the world is about to treat the US government as if it were a money-losing social network.
title: Elon Musk Has a New Project to Run: Trump’s Government

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economic policy and national security editor Nick Wadhams looks at who the president-elect is listening.  Email our editors here.
title: Tucker Carlson and Don Jr. Have Trump’s Ear on Stocking Administration

description: The expected appointment of officials with strong anti-China views to President-elect Donald Trump’s cabinet was welcomed by hedge fund veteran Kyle Bass, even as it risks straining ties between the world’s largest economies.
title: Kyle Bass Hails Trump’s China Hawks as ‘Realists’ on Xi Threat

description: Hours before winning a vote to stay on as Japan’s prime minister, Shigeru Ishiba was caught napping in parliament. But with Donald Trump headed back to the White House, he needs to wake up fast.
title: Trump Return Leaves Japan’s Leader With No Time to Snooze

description: Germany’s election campaign kicks into high gear on Wednesday, when Chancellor Olaf Scholz makes his case in a public address for another term, despite polls showing voters are overwhelmingly looking for a change.
title: Scholz Seeks to Revive Prospects Ahead of German Snap Election

description: The Biden administration sidestepped its own 30-day deadline for Israel to provide significantly more humanitarian aid to the Gaza Strip or face a weapons cutoff, saying only that some progress has been made.
title: US Sidesteps Its 30-Day Deadline for Israel to Improve Gaza Aid

description: A major US oil industry lobbying group is pushing for President-elect Donald Trump and the Republican-controlled Congress to boost offshore crude-lease sales, reform permitting and quickly process applications related to liquefied natural gas shipments.
title: Oil Lobbyists Ask Trump for More Offshore Leases, LNG Approvals

description: “Make America Great Again” has long been a signature phrase at Donald Trump’s rally speeches. Its recent offshoot, “Make America Healthy Again” or MAHA, is now spreading on social media as fitness influencers and parents embrace a push by Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to clean up US food production.
title: ‘Make America Healthy Again’: RFK Jr. Wins Over Fans by Stoking Food Toxin Fear

description: President-elect Donald Trump has only begun to fill out the ranks of his incoming administration. His first choices confirm that his son Donald Jr. and the former Fox TV personality Tucker Carlson have emerged as major influences over his picks.
title: Trump’s Early Staff Picks Show Sway Held by Don Jr., Tucker Carlson

description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s government is likely to approve a coalition partner’s proposal to water down a mooted tax increase on crypto trades, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: Italy Poised to Water Down Proposed 42% Tax on Crypto Trading

description: Alberta’s government has considered hiring former Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper to oversee its public pension fund manager, which is without a permanent board after all of its directors were fired last week, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Former Canadian Prime Minister Harper Eyed as Alberta Pension Chairman

description: Meta Platforms Inc. rebuffed the Federal Trade Commission’s plans to modify a 2020 privacy settlement with the company, arguing that such a move would need approval from a federal court.
title: Meta Pushes Back Against FTC Effort to Toughen Privacy Order

description: French lawmakers rejected a heavily amended version of the country’s 2025 budget, sending the debate over how to plug holes in public finances to the senate.
title: French Budget Punted to Senate After Lower House Rejects Bill

description: For much of his campaign to return to the White House, President-elect Donald Trump was facing four separate criminal prosecutions. Now that he’s won, prosecutors are moving to drop his two federal cases, and the two cases brought by states are in peril as well.
title: What’s Up With Trump’s Criminal Cases Now That He’s Been Reelected?

description: Germany’s new finance minister dismissed fears the political turmoil in Berlin will trigger a funding freeze, pledging the federal government will be fully capable of functioning in the weeks before February’s early election.
title: Germany’s New Finance Chief Rules Out Federal Funding Freeze

description: Keir Starmer’s former chief of staff declined a new role that was offered to her in his administration, effectively ending an acrimonious relationship that posed an early political test for the UK prime minister.
title: Starmer’s Ousted Top Aide Sue Gray Won’t Take Up New UK Post

description: Today, we look back at Basecamp’s ban on political talk at work, and look ahead to the prospects for labor under a new Trump White House.
title: A Founder Who Banned Political Talk at Work Has a Word of Caution for Others

description: Nigeria is seeking a $5 billion trade facility from Saudi Arabia to shore up capital for its economic reform program.
title: Nigeria Seeks $5 Billion Trade Facility From Saudi Arabia

description: President-elect Donald Trump will meet with House Republicans on Wednesday as the party awaits the prospect of scoring a trifecta in Washington with control of both chambers of Congress and the White House.
title: Trump to Go to Capitol as Republicans Near House Majority

description: Germany’s new finance minister used his first public speech since taking office to voice sharp criticism of the tactics UniCredit SpA used in building a major stake in Commerzbank AG.
title: New German Finance Chief Slams UniCredit’s Commerzbank Approach

description: Justin Trudeau’s government directed an independent labor board to end lockouts at Canada’s largest ports, as it did with railways in August, to avoid an economic disruption in the country.
title: Canada Orders Ports to Restart as Labor Disputes Choke Trade

description: Donald Trump is planning to ask a New York judge to throw out his hush-money conviction in the wake of his election victory, his latest attempt to quickly resolve myriad legal threats before he takes office.
title: Trump Lawyers Get More Time to Argue for Dismissal of NY Case

description: The US Supreme Court left intact a ruling that curbs the Justice Department’s ability to use federal antitrust law to prosecute people and companies for bid-rigging, price-fixing and other collusion.
title: Supreme Court Lets Stand Ruling Curbing Bid-Rigging Prosecutions

description: The US Supreme Court refused to shift the Georgia election-interference prosecution of former White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows into federal court, rejecting an appeal from the onetime top aide to Donald Trump.
title: Ex-Trump Aide Meadows Rejected by Supreme Court in Georgia Case

description: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic signaled that Elon Musk was present during a phone call with Donald Trump on Sunday, calling his phone call with the US president-elect a “great honor.”
title: Serbia’s Vucic Signals Musk Was Present During Trump Call

description: Some of President-elect Donald Trump’s key advisers are backing Scott Bessent, who runs macro hedge fund Key Square Group, as the best choice to serve as Treasury secretary, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Key Advisers to Trump Back Bessent for Treasury Secretary

description: The nominee for the European Union’s top foreign policy post said the bloc should tap some $300 billion in frozen Russian assets directly to fund the rebuilding of war-battered Ukraine.
title: EU’s Kallas Backs Tapping Russian Assets Directly to Aid Kyiv

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping has ordered local authorities to ensure safety and social stability after 35 people were killed and 43 injured in a car ramming incident in the southern city of Zhuhai.
title: Xi Orders Safety as China Rocked by Rare Attack That Kills 35

description: Ghana’s Supreme Court reinstated the governing party’s majority in parliament, overruling a decision by the house’s speaker to declare four seats vacant.
title: Ghana’s Top Court Reinstates Ruling-Party Parliamentary Majority

description: The European Central Bank plans to demand more information from banks about their exposure to geopolitical risks as supervision head Claudia Buch puts her stamp on the institution.
title: ECB Is Set to Step Up Focus on Geopolitical Risks at Banks

description: Activists who downplay climate change delivered a wish list to Trump’s transition team, with one calling his win “a tremendous opportunity” to reverse US policy.
title: Climate Skeptics Urge Trump to Boost Coal, Gut Science in Agencies

description: The divide in people’s views of the economy and their own financial situation has been narrowing.
title: How a Perception Gap Motivated American Voters, in Charts

description: The text to Elon Musk: a picture of giant scissors. Musk’s text back: a picture of a sword.
title: The Wall Street CEO Raising His Hand to Run Trump’s Economy

description: Donald Trump’s hold over the incoming Republican US Senate faces an early test Wednesday as a longtime ally of the president-elect seeks to win a leadership fight against two bastions of the party establishment.
title: Trump, Musk Face Early Test of Sway Over Senate in Leader Fight

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: China Is Enemy No. 1 for Trump’s New Team

description: The Philippines said on Tuesday it protested China’s baselines adjacent to the disputed Scarborough Shoal in the South China Sea.
title: Philippines Protests China’s Baselines Around Disputed Shoal

description: The chief executive of Exxon Mobil Corp. on Tuesday discouraged President-elect Donald Trump from withdrawing the US from the landmark Paris climate pact, arguing that would mean forfeiting a chance to push for “common sense” carbon-cutting policy on the world stage.
title: Exxon CEO Pushes Back on Trump’s Radical Anti-Climate Agenda

description: Three tankers loaded crude at the Murmansk terminal in the week to Nov. 10
title: Russia’s Seaborne Crude Flows Rebound on Higher Arctic Shipments

description: Chaotic policymaking may delay the arrival of new import taxes.
title: A Guide to Trump’s Tariff Plans: Expect High Drama and a Bumpy Rollout

description: Germany’s biggest labor union struck a key wage agreement with employers that may raise pay for about 3.9 million workers and avert strikes in the country’s beleaguered manufacturing sector.
title: Germany’s Largest Union Agrees Key Pay Deal for Metal Workers

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s Social Democrats and opposition lawmakers reached an agreement to hold an early election in February, according to government officials familiar with the talks.
title: German Lawmakers Agree to Hold Early Election in February

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s Social Democrats and opposition lawmakers are close to an agreement on holding an early election in February, according to government officials familiar with the talks, who asked not to be identified discussing confidential planning.
title: German Lawmakers Near Deal for Early Election in February

description: India’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the nation may ease some import taxes as long as the move doesn’t hurt local companies, indicating that the South Asian country could soften its trade restrictions after US president-elect Donald Trump called it the “biggest charger” of tariffs.
title: India May Ease Tariffs If No Harm to Economy, Finance Chief Says

description: The European Union has “to consider a scenario where our support” for Ukraine increases in the wake of Donald Trump’s victory in US presidential election, according to the EU’s top foreign policy official Josep Borrell.
title: EU Will Have to Consider Boosting Aid for Ukraine, Borrell Says

description: Thailand’s cabinet approved two additional holidays next year to encourage people to travel during the long weekends to stimulate tourism and support Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy.
title: Thailand Declares Extra Holidays to Spur Tourism-Reliant Economy

description: The Taliban-led government in Afghanistan said it wants a fresh start with the US under President-elect Donald Trump and secure long-sought access to more than $9 billion of the nation’s foreign exchange reserves seized three years ago.
title: Taliban Eyes Trump Reset With $9 Billion in Reserves at Stake

description: The premium on African sovereign debt over US Treasuries has dropped to a five-year low, signaling investor confidence in certain high-yield bonds even as concerns linger about how Donald Trump’s second presidency will impact the continent.
title: Africa’s Debt Premium Eases Ahead of Trump’s Return to the White House

description: Donald Trump is tapping South Dakota Governor Kristi Noem to head the Department of Homeland Security, CNN said, selecting a loyalist once seen as a potential vice presidential candidate for a job that includes securing the US border and carrying out a promised mass deportation.
title: Trump Picks South Dakota Governor Noem for Homeland Security

description: Finland’s President Alexander Stubb said a call he had with Donald Trump on Monday night made clear the president-elect needs to be taken seriously when he speaks about ending Russia’s war in Ukraine.
title: Finland’s President Sees Trump Seeking Peace in Ukraine Quickly

description: Finland President Alexander Stubb discusses his recent phone call with US President-elect Donald Trump, during which the two also discussed the situation in Ukraine. “We in Europe and the rest of the world need to understand that Donald Trump is very serious about getting a peace deal sooner rather than later,” Stubb tells Bloomberg Television.
title: Stubb Says Trump ‘Very Serious’ About Peace in Ukraine

description: President-elect Donald Trump has started to choose the people he wants to carry out his “America First” policies on the border, trade, the economy and more.
title: Who’s Who in Trump’s New Administration

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s choice of three ardently pro-Israel lawmakers for top foreign policy jobs underscores that his focus will be on heightening support for Israel and boxing in Iran once he takes office.
title: Trump Ramps Up Israel Support, Iran Pressure With Top Job Picks

description: A Spanish socialist with a long record in charting her country’s climate policy is on the cusp of taking over from Big tech nemesis Margrethe Vestager as the European Union’s next antitrust chief.
title: Spain’s Climate Champion Gears Up for the EU’s Top Antitrust Job

description: Democratic Representative Ruben Gallego defeated Republican Kari Lake in the Arizona Senate race, according to the Associated Press.
title: Gallego Wins Arizona Senate Race; Democrats Hold Seat

description: Indonesia President Prabowo Subianto congratulated Donald Trump in a phone call on Sunday and may meet the president-elect in person this week, as he seeks to build links with the incoming administration.
title: Indonesia’s Prabowo Courts Trump, Meets Top Executives in US

description: Donald Trump Jr. is joining 1789 Capital, a venture capital firm that invests in conservative-leaning companies, according to people familiar with his plans.
title: Donald Trump Jr. Opts Out of White House to Join 1789 Capital

description: Republican incumbent Mike Garcia conceded defeat to Democrat George Whitesides in the California’s 27th Congressional District election, according to his post on X.
title: Democrat Whitesides Wins California 27th District House Race

description: Australia is better prepared for a return of President-elect Donald Trump to the White House than it was in 2016 following a concerted effort to build ties with his allies and supporters, according to former Ambassador to the US Arthur Sinodinos.
title: Australia ‘Well Prepared’ for Trump’s Return, Ex-Ambassador Says

description: President-elect Donald Trump is expected to name Marco Rubio as secretary of state, a person familiar with the matter said Monday night, granting a top job in his second administration to a one-time rival who later became one of his most ardent supporters in the Senate.
title: Trump Expected to Choose Marco Rubio as Next Secretary of State

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s pick for national security advisor says the US should work to end conflicts in Europe and the Middle East so it can confront “the greater threat” from China, a signal relations between the superpowers could fray further in the coming years.
title: Trump’s Security Advisor Pick Sees China as ‘the Greater Threat’

description: China is planning to cut taxes for home purchases as the government dials up fiscal support to revive a moribund housing market, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: China Plans to Slash Homebuying Taxes in Fiscal Stimulus Push

description: President-elect Donald Trump picked Florida congressman Mike Waltz as his national security advisor, a person familiar with the matter said, elevating the former Army Green Beret and combat veteran to become one his closest aides.
title: Trump Picks Combat Vet Waltz as National Security Advisor

description: China has reduced its exposure to the US economy since Donald Trump’s first administration, leaving it better placed to weather the punitive trade tariffs being pledged by the president-elect, according to Robert Friedland, the founder of Ivanhoe Mines Ltd.
title: Ivanhoe’s Friedland Says Fears for China on US Tariffs Overblown
